content.description: Start squatting on good crimps at waist level and move up on jugs just to the right of the arete.
content.location: The second route to the left and around the corner from from Keep Your Eye On The Prize.

content.description: Start squatting on a crimpy rail at chest level and move up to better crimps, then jugs. Top out up and left through the notch.
content.location: Around the corner from Keep Your Eye On The Prize. About five feet right of Smooth Sailing.

content.description: This is the extended start to Hidden Arete. Instead of starting standing at the corner of the boulder on Hidden Arete, start sitting 6-7 feet right farther around the corner with a huge right hand sidepull and small left hand crimp. Pull off the ground and get into better holds. Heelhooks, tension, and some campus moves will take you around the corner to the start of Hidden Arete. Finish on Hidden Arete.
content.location: This is the extended start to Hidden Arete.

climbs.name: Keep Your Eyes On The Prize

content.description: Start sitting low with a right hand sidepull and left on a low good hold on the arete. Get a good heel hook on the arete and climb directly up the slightly overhanging face getting a crimpy pinch and then making use of a slopey sidepull out right. Top out up and left making an awesome finishing move to a good, but sharp edge. This problem is harder the shorter you are.
content.location: To the left of Hidden Arete, it climbs the perfect, left side of the face from a full sit.

content.description: Climbs the obvious, left-leaning arete on the Hidden Boulder that faces down the hill. Start standing at the corner and climb the super fun arete. Top out the highest point of the boulder.
content.location: This is the obvious, left-leaning arete on the Hidden Boulder.

content.description: A short link up of two problems. Start as for Smooth Sailing and move right into the finish of Smooth Driving.

Sit start on the rock with a low left sidepull and a higher right hand crimp in the seam. Move up to the left hand triangular crimp/pinch, then bump right to the sloping sidepull, and set up and gun for the high edge. This option does not use the left arete as for the problem Keep Your Eyes on the Prize and is thus slightly harder.
content.location: This ascends the far left, gently overhanging face.

content.description: This is a nice granite block hidden out in the woods off one of the trails leading up to the stone tower. Not too many lines here, but the ones there are of high quality.
